title: Spotify’s Stock Is Risky Because the Music Industry Is Not Changing Fast Enough
summary: Some investors believe that the streaming service could become the Netflix of audio. But Apple, Amazon, and the record labels stand in the way.

title: The Klein Law Firm Reminds Investors of Class Actions on Behalf of Shareholders of CRCM, BA and AAPL
summary: NEW YORK, NY / ACCESSWIRE / April 19, 2019 / The Klein Law Firm announces that class action complaints have been filed on behalf of shareholders of the following companies.  If you suffered a loss you have until the lead plaintiff deadline to request that the court appoint you as lead plaintiff.  The complaint alleges that Defendants made false and/or misleading statements, as well as failed to disclose material adverse facts, with respect to the manner in which the Company vets the caregivers and daycare providers listed on its website.

title: INVESTOR ACTION ALERT: The Schall Law Firm Announces the Filing of a Class Action Lawsuit Against Apple Inc. and Encourages Investors with Losses in Excess of $100,000 to Contact the Firm
summary: LOS ANGELES, CA / ACCESSWIRE / April 19, 2019 / The Schall Law Firm, a national shareholder rights litigation firm, announces the filing of a class action lawsuit against Apple Inc. ("Apple" or "the Company") (NASDAQ: AAPL) for violations of §§10(b) and 20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Rule 10b-5 promulgated thereunder by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Investors who purchased the Company's shares between November 2, 2018 and January 2, 2019, inclusive (the ''Class Period''), are encouraged to contact the firm before June 17, 2019.

title: CLASS ACTION UPDATE for CAG, CVS and AAPL: Levi & Korsinsky, LLP Reminds Investors of Class Actions on Behalf of Shareholders

title: CORRECTION: SHAREHOLDER ALERT - Apple Inc. (AAPL) Bronstein, Gewirtz & Grossman, LLC Announces Class Action and Lead Plaintiff Deadline: June 17, 2019
summary: NEW YORK, NY / ACCESSWIRE / April 19, 2019 / Bronstein, Gewirtz & Grossman, LLC reminds investors that a class action lawsuit has been filed againstApple Inc. ("Apple" or the "Company") (AAPL) and certain of its officers, on behalf of shareholders who purchased or otherwise acquired Apple securities between November 2, 2018 and January 2, 2019, both dates inclusive.  The complaint alleges that during the Class Period, defendants made materially false and misleading statements and/or failed to disclose adverse information regarding Apple's business and prospects.

title: Is Zuckerberg lacking the maturity to deal with Facebook's data breach issues?
summary: Former Microsoft COO Bob Herbold on the privacy issues plaguing Facebook and Uber's efforts to address safety concerns.

title: Qualcomm Gets Multiple Upgrades after Apple Dispute Settlement
summary: Qualcomm Surges on Apple Settlement and Intel's 5G Chip Exit(Continued from Prior Part)Qualcomm rise after settling a dispute with Apple Qualcomm (QCOM) stock has gained 38.3% and added $30 billion to its market value since it resolved its legal

title: TV's Golden Age, or TV Overload? Battle for Dominance Has No Clear Winners
summary: TV+, consumers have more choice than ever in direct-to-consumer entertainment.  The options for entertainment are so plentiful that for many TV fans, it's becoming too much of a good thing.  "I plan to subscribe to the new challengers if they have content I want and if it is easy to unsubscribe when I'm done," said Arnold Valentino, a 36-year-old in the Bay Area who currently subscribes to Netflix, Hulu and Amazon Prime.

title: Why Intel's Smartphone Strategy Went off the Rails (Again)
summary: The chipmaker’s second act in smartphones comes to an abrupt end as Apple switches to Qualcomm.
